“Your son misrepresented my words,” Luzhin said, bowing to Razumihin.  
“Marriage with a poor girl is more advantageous,” he continued.  
“Your son exaggerated my intentions.”  

Pulcheria Alexandrovna faltered, “I don’t remember.”  
“I repeated them as I understood,” she added.  
“Perhaps he exaggerated.”  

“He could not have exaggerated,” Luzhin insisted.  
“Your instigation led to this.”  

“Pyotr Petrovitch,” she replied, “we did not take your words badly.”  
“Good, mother,” Dounia said approvingly.  

“Now it’s my fault?” Luzhin asked, aggrieved.  
“You wrote falsehoods about him,” Pulcheria Alexandrovna said, gaining courage.  
“I don’t remember writing anything false,” Luzhin replied.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Luzhin accuses Raskolnikov of misrepresenting his words, while Pulcheria Alexandrovna defends her son and challenges Luzhin's claims.
